\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 title: "R Consortium Grants Working Group Announces New Chair"
\f1\fs24 \

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 description: "The R Consortium is pleased to announce that Katherine Jeschke has been appointed Chair of the Grants Committee."
\f1\fs24 \

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 author: "R Consortium"
\f1\fs24 \

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 image: "psug2024-main2.png"
\f1\fs24 \

\f1\fs24 \

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 ---
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 ![Katherine](Katherine.png)
\f1\fs24 \
\
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 The R Consortium is pleased to announce that Katherine Jeschke has been appointed Chair of the Grants Committee.
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 She will oversee day-to-day grant processes for both pre- and post-awards, ensuring grants meet the R Consortium\'92s strategic objectives. Katherine will report to the Executive Director and work closely with the Infrastructure Steering Committee and the RUGS program to track grants and help improve the effectiveness of R Consortium grants in supporting the R Community.
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 Katherine\'92s non-profit grants and administration skills were honed over more than 25 years of experience in marketing communications, and staff, budget, development, and grants management for non-profits and trade organizations, as well as corporate and public sector consulting organizations.\'a0
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 She holds an MA degree in American History and Museum Administration from George Washington University and a BA degree in Fine Arts and Art History from the University of Maryland.
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 \'93Getting acquainted with our various grants and procedures while evaluating the strategic effectiveness of R Consortium grants is a big undertaking, but her background and years of experience should ease her way,\'94 said Joseph Rickert, Executive Director of the R Consortium.
\f1\fs24 \
\

\f0\fs29\fsmilli14667 She may be reached at kj.jeschke@posit.co.
\f1\fs24 \
}
